title: STEEM Bots - The Automation Ecosystem (2016-2018)
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family + Steem Wiki
overview: Comprehensive documentation of bot ecosystem on STEEM blockchain - foundation for current HIVE automation strategies

definition.what_is_bot: Software application running automated tasks (scripts) over internet or blockchain
definition.characteristics: Simple, structurally repetitive tasks at superhuman speed
definition.internet_stat: More than half of all web traffic is bots
definition.largest_use: Web spidering/crawling - fetching and analyzing data

bot_vs_script.bot: Watches for events to act upon, runs continuously
bot_vs_script.script: Runs once to perform specific operation, then quits
bot_vs_script.example_bot: Watch for new posts and vote on them
bot_vs_script.example_script: Vote on a specific post and quit
bot_vs_script.key_difference: Bots run for long periods looking for criteria

complexity_levels.simple_bot: Limited conditions - 'if new post, upvote it'

philosophy.core_insight: No CAPTCHAs on blogging interface = AI can interact freely
philosophy.bazillion_beings: Army of automated agents working for members
philosophy.passive_income: Bots generate revenue while you sleep
philosophy.evolution: Early experiments led to modern HIVE curation bots

original_7_bots_july_2016.context: 200-400 posts per day in early days, grew to 8,000+ posts/day
original_7_bots_july_2016.philosophy_quote: Don't hate the Bots, they are an important part of the Steemit Ecosystem
